main event: A spherical, bright fiery red object was sighted over the ocean near Japan in 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a pea and had a tail that was streaming behind it, diminishing in brightness.
The object was seen by an experienced naval officer who considered the sighting reliable.
The object appeared to fall straight down, then reappear and descend rapidly, lasting for about 39 seconds.
The sighting occurred at night with a clear sky and 40% cloud coverage, and the observers noticed an unusually bright and magnified moon.
The commanding officer believed the object was likely a meteor, but there was no physical evidence collected.
sighted object: a spherical, bright fiery red object
